Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/301cb0bc17ca76a396dc75e2651dee4d/tumblr_inline_n9nmmkIEKO1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/9GWwqs6Y37Y" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p><strong>UpsilonAerospace</strong> sent in a beautiful music track inspired by Duna. Get ready for this instrumental’s smooth strings to tug at your own heartstrings.</p>

Wow. Wow. Wow.

I am hyperventilating right now.

Thank you so, so much, SQUAD! You are the best.

[Editing this into the first post: Here's the download link, which should work maybe! Sorry for the clunky format and the misleading title (July 2011, seriously?) It should still work ]

Edited August 2, 2014 by UpsilonAerospace

Listened to this a few days ago. Really great job

Not to sure about the bass though.

Listened to this a few days ago. Really great job

Not to sure about the bass though.

Aww, are you kidding? The bass line is my favorite part!

Still in disbelief about this entire thing. Pinching myself now.

Aww, are you kidding? The bass line is my favorite part!

Still in disbelief about this entire thing. Pinching myself now.

It still works really well, but it would be cool if there was also an orchestral bass.

Just think it would fit better with the melody

This totally deserved it! Congrats man .

Edited August 2, 2014 by Avera9eJoe

It still works really well, but it would be cool if there was also an orchestral bass.

Just think it would fit better with the melody

I actually played all of the tracks but the bass line myself, on my awesome li'l violin. I'm okay at playing the violin, but I could not play any sort of cello/bass-like instrument to save my life.

The program I used for this, straight-up GarageBand, doesn't have a good synth bass except for the one I used (IMHO). Otherwise, I would probably have used another type of synthesizer.

Thanks for the feedback though, I appreciate any comments on how to make my music better for next time

This totally deserved it! Congrats man .

Thanks, Avera9eJoe! I really want to hear you play that snare drum over this, I think it'll be epic.
That is a lovely little piece! Thanks to Squad for drawing our attention to it, and many thanks to Upsilon for composing it!

That is a lovely little piece! Thanks to Squad for drawing our attention to it, and many thanks to Upsilon for composing it!

It was my pleasure, Softweir. I really love composing things, and this is one of my favorite pieces that I've made so far.

Heading off to bed, now, so I'll be off the forum until morning. Thanks for all of the kind words, everyone.

Wow, that's just awesomesauce. I really hope you do more of this, say 2-3 for each celestial body (one orbit, two ground.) I'd happily make a plugin that plays them in the game. Feel free to contact me
Now all we need is sandstorms and Duna shall be complete!

great. duna is one of my favorite planet in KSP and now it has a song

Now all we need is sandstorms and Duna shall be complete!

This mod gives you sandstorms on duna

Wow, that's just awesomesauce. I really hope you do more of this, say 2-3 for each celestial body (one orbit, two ground.) I'd happily make a plugin that plays them in the game. Feel free to contact me

The attention and happy aid from a famous modder... This is beginning to sound to good to be true. I am happy to aid in any music with jazz drum set/percussion/maybe piano. After I prove myself of course .

Upsilon you've created the musical brainchild I've been waiting for .
Cool song Bagel Rabbit! This would be cool in game! If only
Really great! Had a bit of Firefly feeling from it.

That was absolutely brilliant! Is there a series on the table for all the bodies in ksp? Then a plugin to play them when we land! That would be the best and most awesome mod ever! One of those totally useless but truly awesome mods that changes the game forever!

Everyone seems to like this music so much! I'm actually sort of surprised.

I'm currently thinking about making more of these and having some modder (probably Blizzy76, as he's really cool) put them into the game as a plugin. I feel like getting the support of a famous modder to make music for a game plugin is almost too good to be true.

The only reason why I'm not immediately jumping on the bandwagon is that I'm not sure if I have the time for one of these large projects, as I have loads of other stuff going on in my life.

I'll think about it... and I want it to happen just as much as some of the people on this thread. I just don't want to say "Yes, I'll do it!" and then not get through all of the pieces. That would be majorly disappointing.

I too was reminded of Firefly. Nice work. I've wanted more music added by Squad to the game for some time; a close second would be such a mod mentioned above which allows one to play other music in-game. UA's tune would be one I'd add that way. Thanks for the possibilities!

Squad should consider adding mod support for music. The entire music section of the game is beyond easy modding, but we know the code is there as the music switches between menus and when you enter space. I wish they would make that module open so I could add this song to DUNA. Would launch a mission just for the music!

This song so reminds me of sea shanties that I can imagine lyrics:

I've been on the Dunar sands,

waiting for my rescue,

storming through the weathering gale,

on this murderous world.

[instruments]

I've awaited the light of descent

--I've awaited my rescue--

but no-one seems to be coming.

I've been dreaming of Kerbinar hills,

but they seem too far to me now.

I've awaited the sky's

Return to undaunted darkness.

I've been on the Dunar sands,

waiting for my rescue,

storming through the howling gale,

on the sand dunes endless.

I've been waiting for my ship

I've been waiting for years.

When I see the trail of descent,

I will rise and dance and sing.

I can sing from high bass to low tenor: would you like to do a vocal collaboration with me?

-Duxwing

P.S. These lyrics are a rough draft I can improve and make rhyme if needed. Using these lyrics, unrhymed and somewhat nonsensical, can create dissonance reflecting the possible madness of the singer and contrasting with the serene music.

Edited August 2, 2014 by Duxwing

Wow, that should totally be in game for when you are in Duna's atmosphere. Also, if you want, I can play cello decently. I just need a voice recorder and a sheet of music I need to play and I could totally do that.

This song so reminds me of sea shanties that I can imagine lyrics:

[snip]

I can sing from high bass to low tenor: would you like to do a vocal collaboration with me?

-Duxwing

P.S. These lyrics are a rough draft I can improve and make rhyme if needed. Using these lyrics, unrhymed and somewhat nonsensical, can create dissonance reflecting the possible madness of the singer and contrasting with the serene music.

I cannot sing to save my life, but I'm quite open to having a vocal track on top of this song. Go for it! If you include a YouTube link of the song that you create, I'll link it in the description of the DUNA video.

A note on the lyrics: I really like the way that they're structured right now, but if you want to make them rhyme or find any way to improve them, that would be nice too. Literally the only thing that I would change would be "--on the sand dunes endless," which I think would sound better as "--on the endless sand dunes." Your choice.

Wow, that should totally be in game for when you are in Duna's atmosphere. Also, if you want, I can play cello decently. I just need a voice recorder and a sheet of music I need to play and I could totally do that.

If I decide to go ahead and create music for a plug-in, I may well be recruiting your help for some of the songs. Thanks for the offer!
There could totally be room in fanworks for a music collection xD Just sayin... If there got to be enough...
That's really beautiful. You know what bothers me, tho? The video. The sun is on the back, yet the shades on the dunes are towards it!

That's really beautiful. You know what bothers me, tho? The video. The sun is on the back, yet the shades on the dunes are towards it!

Looking at the video, you're right. Dangit!

There are actually plenty of things wrong with the video, the most easily noticeable one being the clouds in the background resetting their positions every fifteen or twenty seconds. If I would have known the popularity of this video I definitely would have spent more time on it.

Thanks for the observation... I wish it wasn't too late to completely rework the video.
